user_review: Super cute little stand in the McGill metro station. We go there for the rice balls, which are wrapped in a clever packaging that prevents the seaweed from getting soggy form the rice. The seaweed stays crispy, and also prevent your fingers from getting dirty from handling the food. There's a nice selection of flavors, including tuna, kimchi, spicy or non spicy, tofu, etc. It's not too expensive and quite filling! The black rice in the rice ball, which give it a beautiful purple color. A nice treat on the way to or off work.

Another new cheap eats in Montreal dowtown. Located right in the middle of McGill station.I wouldn't recommend to take the Poke bowl though. They are not very generous in salmon and it is already mixed with a mayo base sauce. I personally prefer soya sauce. Two onigiris for $6 and they have good variety to choose from.
If you like seaweed flavors you will be filled with joy. Not a lot of vegetarian selections but I did try the spicy tofu with was not bad. Overall good quality food for a medium ranged price.
Sweetest lady ever. Always greets me with a smile. I get her kimchi every week, it's so delicious I finish it within 1-2 days!
